column4: Say I install Ubuntu on external HDD: is it possible to create an image backup of that HDD, so in case HDD breaks or gets lost, I could copy the image to a new HDD, and continue using it as before.
I think ubuntu has a package called clone2fs, which can clone a filesystem, kinda like ghost
there's also a utility called 'dd' but that will copy the entire contents, even space on your hard drive that is not used
